+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,144 @@\n+import { mapIntent } from './intentMapper.js';\n+\n+export function generatePostIdeas(aggregatedAnalysis) {\n+  const ideas = [];\n+  \n+  // Analyze the day's work and generate different angles\n+  const { totalCommits, signals, impacts, totalWeight } = aggregatedAnalysis;\n+  \n+  // Idea 1: High-level daily summary\n+  ideas.push({\n+    type: 'daily_summary',\n+    angle: 'productivity',\n+    title: `üìä Daily Summary: ${totalCommits} commits`,\n+    description: `Overview of the day's work with key metrics`,\n+    metadata: {\n+      commits: totalCommits,\n+      filesChanged: aggregatedAnalysis.totalFilesChanged,\n+      totalWeight,\n+      impacts\n+    }\n+  });\n+  \n+  // Idea 2: Focus on the most significant change type\n+  const topSignal = getTopSignal(signals);\n+  if (topSignal) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'focused_technical',\n+      angle: topSignal.signal,\n+      title: `üîß ${formatSignalName(topSignal.signal)}`,\n+      description: `Deep dive into the main technical work of the day`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        signal: topSignal.signal,\n+        count: topSignal.count,\n+        percentage: ((topSignal.count / Object.values(signals).reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0)) * 100).toFixed(0)\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  // Idea 3: Learning/growth angle (if async or error handling)\n+  if (signals.async_change || signals.promise_change || signals.error_handling_change) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'learning',\n+      angle: 'async_mastery',\n+      title: `üìö Learning: Async Patterns`,\n+      description: `Share insights about async programming challenges`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        async_changes: signals.async_change || 0,\n+        promise_changes: signals.promise_change || 0,\n+        error_handling: signals.error_handling_change || 0\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  // Idea 4: Documentation/build in public (if doc changes)\n+  if (signals.doc_image_change || signals.doc_heading_change || signals.doc_link_change) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'build_in_public',\n+      angle: 'documentation',\n+      title: `üìù Documentation Progress`,\n+      description: `Share the importance of good documentation`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        doc_changes: (signals.doc_image_change || 0) + (signals.doc_heading_change || 0) + (signals.doc_link_change || 0)\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  // Idea 5: High-stakes technical decision (if high risk changes)\n+  if (impacts.HIGH_RISK > 0) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'technical_decision',\n+      angle: 'risk_management',\n+      title: `‚ö†Ô∏è Technical Decisions: Managing Risk`,\n+      description: `Discuss careful engineering decisions made today`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        highRiskCommits: impacts.HIGH_RISK,\n+        networking: signals.networking_change || 0,\n+        env_variables: signals.env_variable_change || 0\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  // Idea 6: Refactoring/code quality (if large weight)\n+  if (totalWeight > 500) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'engineering_practice',\n+      angle: 'refactoring',\n+      title: `‚ôªÔ∏è Big Refactor: ${totalWeight} lines changed`,\n+      description: `Share the story of a major code improvement`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        linesChanged: totalWeight,\n+        commits: totalCommits\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  // Idea 7: Testing focus (if test changes)\n+  if (signals.test_change) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'quality',\n+      angle: 'testing',\n+      title: `‚úÖ Testing & Quality`,\n+      description: `Emphasize the importance of testing`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        testChanges: signals.test_change\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  // Idea 8: Multi-faceted day (if many different signal types)\n+  const signalTypes = Object.keys(signals).length;\n+  if (signalTypes >= 5) {\n+    ideas.push({\n+      type: 'variety',\n+      angle: 'full_stack_day',\n+      title: `üåà Full-Stack Day: ${signalTypes} different types of work`,\n+      description: `Highlight the variety of work accomplished`,\n+      metadata: {\n+        signalTypes,\n+        signals: Object.keys(signals)\n+      }\n+    });\n+  }\n+  \n+  return ideas;\n+}\n+\n+function getTopSignal(signals) {\n+  const entries = Object.entries(signals);\n+  if (entries.length === 0) return null;\n+  \n+  entries.sort((a, b) => b[1] - a[1]);\n+  return {\n+    signal: entries[0][0],\n+    count: entries[0][1]\n+  };\n+}\n+\n+function formatSignalName(signal) {\n+  return signal\n+    .replace(/_/g, ' ')\n+    .split(' ')\n+    .map(word => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1))\n+    .join(' ');\n+}\n\\ No newline at end of file"
+    }
+  ]
+}"

` by ${author}` : ''}`);\n+    \n+    const res = await axios.get(url, {\n+        headers: {\n+            'Authorization': `Bearer ${process.env.GITHUB_TOKEN}`,\n+            'Accept': 'application/vnd.github.v3+json'\n+        },\n+        params\n+    });\n+    \n+    const commits = res.data;\n+    console.log(`Found ${commits.length} commits in the last 24 hours`);\n+    \n+    // Fetch detailed info for each commit\n+    const detailedCommits = [];\n+    for (const commit of commits) {\n+        const detailUrl = `https://api.github.com/repos/${repo}/commits/${commit.sha}`;\n+        const detailRes = await axios.get(detailUrl, {\n+            headers: {\n+                'Authorization': `Bearer ${process.env.GITHUB_TOKEN}`,\n+                'Accept': 'application/vnd.github.v3+json'\n+            }\n+        });\n+        detailedCommits.push(detailRes.data);\n+        \n+        // Save individual commit\n+        const outputDir = path.join(__dirname,'../../data/raw');\n+        await fs.ensureDir(outputDir);\n+        const filepath = path.join(outputDir,`${repo.replace('/','_')}_${commit.sha}.json`);\n+        await fs.writeJson(filepath, detailRes.data, {spaces:2});\n+    }\n+    \n+    // Save aggregated commits\n+    const outputDir = path.join(__dirname,'../../data/raw');\n+    await fs.ensureDir(outputDir);\n+    const aggregatedPath = path.join(outputDir, `${repo.replace('/','_')}_last24h.json`);\n+    await fs.writeJson(aggregatedPath, detailedCommits, {spaces:2});\n+    console.log(`Aggregated commits saved to ${aggregatedPath}`);\n+    \n+    return detailedCommits;\n+}\n+\n+export { fetchCommit, fetchCommitsLast24Hours };\n\\ No newline at end of file"

+/**
+ * Enhanced Post Composer
+ * Generates personalized, story-driven posts based on actual commit data
+ */
+
+export function composePost(idea, aggregatedAnalysis) {
+  const { commits, signals, totalWeight, totalFilesChanged } = aggregatedAnalysis;
+  
+  // Extract real commit messages and patterns
+  const commitMessages = commits.map(c => c.message.split('\n')[0]);
+  const firstCommit = commits[0];
+  const lastCommit = commits[commits.length - 1];
+  
+  // Build narrative components
+  const narrative = buildNarrative(idea, aggregatedAnalysis, commitMessages);
+  const context = buildContext(idea, aggregatedAnalysis);
+  const reflection = buildReflection(idea, aggregatedAnalysis);
+  const hook = buildHook(idea, aggregatedAnalysis);
+  
+  // Compose the post with natural flow
+  return composeNaturalPost({
+    hook,
+    narrative,
+    context,
+    reflection,
+    idea,
+    aggregatedAnalysis
+  });
+}
+
+function buildHook(idea, analysis) {
+  const { totalCommits, signals, totalWeight } = analysis;
+  
+  switch(idea.type) {
+    case 'daily_summary':
+      if (totalCommits > 10) {
+        return `${totalCommits} commits today. One of those days where you look up and realize you've been in the zone for hours.`;
+      }
+      return `Wrapped up today with ${totalCommits} commits.`;
+    
+    case 'focused_technical':
+      const signalName = formatSignalForReading(idea.metadata.signal);
+      return `Spent most of today deep in ${signalName}.`;
+    
+    case 'learning':
+      return `Hit a learning curve today with async patterns.`;
+    
+    case 'build_in_public':
+      return `Took a step back from features today to focus on documentation.`;
+    
+    case 'technical_decision':
+      return `Made some decisions today that needed more thought than usual.`;
+    
+    case 'engineering_practice':
+      return `${totalWeight} lines changed across ${totalCommits} commits. Big refactor day.`;
+    
+    case 'quality':
+      return `Testing day. Not the most glamorous work, but necessary.`;
+    
+    case 'variety':
+      return `Full-stack kind of day.`;
+    
+    default:
+      return `Made progress today.`;
+  }
+}
+
+function buildNarrative(idea, analysis, commitMessages) {
+  const { totalCommits, signals, totalWeight, totalFilesChanged, commits } = analysis;
+  
+  // Extract actual work done
+  const fileTypes = extractFileTypes(commits);
+  const keyChanges = extractKeyChanges(signals);
+  
+  switch(idea.type) {
+    case 'daily_summary':
+      const fileTypesStr = fileTypes.slice(0, 3).join(', ');
+      return `Touched ${totalFilesChanged} files - mostly ${fileTypesStr}. ${keyChanges[0] || 'Various improvements'} was the main theme.`;
+    
+    case 'focused_technical':
+      const count = idea.metadata.count;
+      return `${count} separate instances of ${formatSignalForReading(idea.metadata.signal)} across the codebase. Started with one file, realized the pattern was everywhere, ended up doing a systematic pass.`;
+    
+    case 'learning':
+      const asyncCount = idea.metadata.async_changes || 0;
+      const promiseCount = idea.metadata.promise_changes || 0;
+      return `Working with ${asyncCount} async changes and ${promiseCount} promise updates. The tricky part isn't writing async code - it's handling all the edge cases when things don't resolve as expected.`;
+    
+    case 'build_in_public':
+      const docCount = idea.metadata.doc_changes;
+      return `${docCount} documentation updates. Added examples, fixed outdated sections, made sure the README actually reflects what the project does now.`;
+    
+    case 'technical_decision':
+      const highRisk = idea.metadata.highRiskCommits;
+      return `${highRisk} commits that touched networking or environment config. These aren't the kind of changes you make lightly - one wrong env variable and things break in production.`;
+    
+    case 'engineering_practice':
+      return `What started as "let me just clean this up" turned into ${totalCommits} commits and ${totalWeight} lines of changes. Sometimes you pull one thread and the whole sweater unravels - in a good way.`;
+    
+    case 'quality':
+      const testCount = idea.metadata.testChanges;
+      return `Added and updated ${testCount} tests. The kind of work that doesn't show up in demos but saves hours of debugging later.`;
+    
+    case 'variety':
+      const signalList = Object.keys(signals).slice(0, 4).map(formatSignalForReading);
+      return `Jumped between ${signalList.join(', ')}. One of those days where you're touching everything from frontend to infrastructure.`;
+    
+    default:
+      return `Working through the backlog, one commit at a time.`;
+  }
+}
+
+function buildContext(idea, analysis) {
+  const { signals, totalWeight } = analysis;
+  
+  switch(idea.type) {
+    case 'focused_technical':
+      return `The codebase was inconsistent - some files using one pattern, others using another. Better to fix it all at once than let it drift further apart.`;
+    
+    case 'learning':
+      return `Async JavaScript still catches me sometimes. You think you understand it, then you hit a race condition or an unhandled rejection that reminds you there's always more to learn.`;
+    
+    case 'build_in_public':
+      return `Good documentation is the difference between someone understanding your project in 5 minutes versus giving up and moving on. Worth the investment.`;
+    
+    case 'technical_decision':
+      return `These changes needed testing, double-checking, and a clear rollback plan. Engineering isn't just about making things work - it's about making sure they keep working.`;
+    
+    case 'engineering_practice':
+      return `The refactor was overdue. Code had accumulated enough cruft that adding new features was getting harder. Sometimes you need to stop and clean house.`;
+    
+    case 'quality':
+      return `Tests are insurance. They don't prevent bugs, but they catch them before users do. And they let you refactor with confidence.`;
+    
+    default:
+      return null;
+  }
+}
+
+function buildReflection(idea, analysis) {
+  switch(idea.type) {
+    case 'daily_summary':
+      return `Not every day needs to be about shipping features. Sometimes it's about making the foundation stronger.`;
+    
+    case 'focused_technical':
+      return `Consistency compounds. Fix patterns once, benefit every time you touch that code.`;
+    
+    case 'learning':
+      return `Still learning. Always will be. That's why this work stays interesting.`;
+    
+    case 'build_in_public':
+      return `Documentation is code. Treat it with the same care.`;
+    
+    case 'technical_decision':
+      return `Good engineering is mostly boring. It's careful, measured, and defensive. That's what makes it reliable.`;
+    
+    case 'engineering_practice':
+      return `Refactoring feels indulgent until you try to add a feature to messy code. Then it feels essential.`;
+    
+    case 'quality':
+      return `The best code is the code that works when you're not watching.`;
+    
+    case 'variety':
+      return `Full-stack work keeps you sharp. You can't hide behind specialization when you're responsible for everything.`;
+    
+    default:
+      return `Progress over perfection. Ship it, learn from it, improve it.`;
+  }
+}
+
+function composeNaturalPost({ hook, narrative, context, reflection, idea }) {
+  const parts = [hook, narrative];
+  
+  if (context) {
+    parts.push(context);
+  }
+  
+  parts.push(reflection);
+  
+  // Join with double line breaks for readability
+  return parts.filter(Boolean).join('\n\n');
+}
+
+function extractFileTypes(commits) {
+  const extensions = new Set();
+  
+  for (const commit of commits) {
+    if (commit.files) {
+      for (const file of commit.files) {
+        const ext = file.filename.split('.').pop();
+        if (ext.length < 5) { // Reasonable extension length
+          extensions.add(ext);
+        }
+      }
     }
-    return template.trim();
+  }
+  
+  const extArray = Array.from(extensions);
+  const displayMap = {
+    'js': 'JavaScript',
+    'ts': 'TypeScript',
+    'jsx': 'React',
+    'tsx': 'React/TS',
+    'md': 'docs',
+    'json': 'config',
+    'css': 'styles',
+    'scss': 'styles',
+  };
+  
+  return extArray.map(ext => displayMap[ext] || ext);
+}
+
+function extractKeyChanges(signals) {
+  const signalPriority = [
+    'async_change',
+    'networking_change',
+    'error_handling_change',
+    'test_change',
+    'promise_change',
+    'function_change',
+    'import_change',
+  ];
+  
+  const found = [];
+  for (const signal of signalPriority) {
+    if (signals[signal]) {
+      found.push(formatSignalForReading(signal));
+    }
+  }
+  
+  return found;
+}
+
+function formatSignalForReading(signal) {
+  const readableMap = {
+    'async_change': 'async/await patterns',
+    'networking_change': 'API calls',
+    'error_handling_change': 'error handling',
+    'test_change': 'testing',
+    'promise_change': 'promise handling',
+    'function_change': 'function refactoring',
+    'import_change': 'dependency updates',
+    'class_change': 'class structures',
+    'logging_change': 'logging',
+    'jsx_change': 'React components',
+    'vue_change': 'Vue components',
+    'doc_image_change': 'documentation images',
+    'doc_heading_change': 'documentation structure',
+    'doc_link_change': 'documentation links',
+    'env_variable_change': 'environment config',
+  };
+  
+  return readableMap[signal] || signal.replace(/_/g, ' ');

+function findDominantSignal(signals) {
   const entries = Object.entries(signals);
   if (entries.length === 0) return null;
   
+  const total = entries.reduce((sum, [_, count]) => sum + count, 0);
   entries.sort((a, b) => b[1] - a[1]);
+  
+  const [signal, count] = entries[0];
+  const percentage = Math.round((count / total) * 100);
+  
+  return { signal, count, percentage };
+}

+function analyzeCommitPatterns(commits) {

+  const wordFreq = {};

+function calculateTimeSpan(commits) {
+  if (commits.length === 0) return 'unknown';
+  
+  const times = commits.map(c => new Date(c.date).getTime());
+  const span = (Math.max(...times) - Math.min(...times)) / (1000 * 60 * 60);
+  
+  if (span < 2) return 'concentrated burst';
+  if (span < 6) return 'morning/afternoon';
+  return 'full day';
+}
+
+function detectWorkPattern(signals, totalWeight, totalCommits) {
+  if (totalCommits > 15 && totalWeight < 300) return 'iterative';
+  if (totalCommits < 5 && totalWeight > 500) return 'big changes';
+  return 'steady progress';
+}

+function getAffectedFileCount(commits, signal) {

+}

+function detectLearningIndicators(commits) {
+  const messages = commits.map(c => c.message.toLowerCase());
+  const indicators = [];
+  
+  if (messages.some(m => m.includes('fix') || m.includes('correct'))) {
+    indicators.push('iterative fixes');
+  }
+  if (messages.some(m => m.includes('refactor') || m.includes('improve'))) {
+    indicators.push('improvements');
+  }
+  
+  return indicators;
+}
+
+function getDocFilesUpdated(commits) {
+  const docFiles = new Set();
+  for (const commit of commits) {
+    if (commit.files) {
+      commit.files
+        .filter(f => f.filename.endsWith('.md'))
+        .forEach(f => docFiles.add(f.filename));
+    }
+  }
+  return Array.from(docFiles);
+}
+
+function detectSafeguards(signals) {
+  const safeguards = [];
+  if (signals.error_handling_change) safeguards.push('error handling');
+  if (signals.test_change) safeguards.push('tests');
+  return safeguards;
+}
+
+function detectRefactorReasons(signals, commits) {
+  const reasons = [];
+  if (signals.function_change > 5) reasons.push('function organization');
+  if (signals.import_change > 3) reasons.push('dependency cleanup');
+  if (signals.class_change > 2) reasons.push('class structure');
+  return reasons;
+}
+
+function categorizeRefactorScope(signals) {

+}
+
+function isCommonWord(word) {
+  const common = ['the', 'and', 'for', 'add', 'update', 'fix', 'with', 'from', 'this', 'that'];

+}

+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@\n+import { callHuggingFace } from \"./Provider.js\";\n+\n+export async function rewritePost({\n+  basePost,\n+  intent,\n+  angle,\n+  facts,\n+  constraints\n+}) {\n+  const prompt = `\n+You are rewriting a developer social media post.\n+\n+Rules:\n+- Do NOT add new facts\n+- Do NOT change the meaning\n+- Keep it authentic and concise\n+- Avoid buzzwords\n+\n+Intent: ${intent}\n+Angle: ${angle}\n+\n+Known facts:\n+${JSON.stringify(facts, null, 2)}\n+\n+Base post:\n+\"\"\"\n+${basePost}\n+\"\"\"\n+\n+Platform: ${constraints.platform}\n+Max length: ${constraints.maxLength}\n+Emoji allowed: ${constraints.emoji}\n+\n+Rewrite the post:\n+`;\n+\n+   return await callHuggingFace(prompt);\n+}"
+    }
+  ]

+      "blob_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/blob/7795b53d8f6d9d6d6a1012d105fa294dbdfde39e/src%2Fpost%2Fcomposer.js",
+      "raw_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/raw/7795b53d8f6d9d6d6a1012d105fa294dbdfde39e/src%2Fpost%2Fcomposer.js",
+      "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/garvthakre/Post90/contents/src%2Fpost%2Fcomposer.js?ref=7795b53d8f6d9d6d6a1012d105fa294dbdfde39e",
+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@\n+import { mapIntent } from './intentMapper.js';\n+import { TEMPLATES } from './templates.js';\n+\n+export function composePost(analysis) {\n+    const intent = mapIntent(analysis);\n+    const template = TEMPLATES[intent.type]?.[intent.angle];\n+    if(!template){\n+        return `Made progress today. Every change, big or small, is a step forward.\n+         Celebrating the wins and learning from the challenges. #devlife`;\n+    }\n+    return template.trim();\n+}\n\\ No newline at end of file"
+    }
+  ]
+}

+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@\n+export const TONES = {\n+  pro: `\n+Write in a professional, clear, industry-standard tone.\n+Concise, factual, and suitable for senior engineers.\n+`,\n+  devlife: `\n+Write like an experienced developer explaining changes to teammates.\n+Friendly, casual, but still clear and technical.\n+`,\n+  fun: `\n+Write in a light, playful developer tone.\n+Still accurate, but slightly witty.\n+`,\n+  concise: `\n+Write extremely concise.\n+No fluff. No emojis. Just the essentials.\n+`,\n+    detailed: `\n+Write in a detailed, explanatory tone.\n+Provide context and reasoning behind changes.\n+`,\n+    optimistic: `\n+Write in an optimistic, positive tone.\n+Focus on progress and learning, even from challenges.\n+`,\n+};"

+      "status": "added",
+      "additions": 39,

+      "changes": 39,
+      "blob_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/blob/7e4e3a581590b399d99630fcb923c281ba0c8ccc/src%2Fpost%2FintentMapper.js",
+      "raw_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/raw/7e4e3a581590b399d99630fcb923c281ba0c8ccc/src%2Fpost%2FintentMapper.js",
+      "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/garvthakre/Post90/contents/src%2Fpost%2FintentMapper.js?ref=7e4e3a581590b399d99630fcb923c281ba0c8ccc",
+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,39 @@\n+export function mapIntent(analysis){\n+    const {impact,signals,totalWeight} = analysis;\n+    if(impact === 'HIGH_RISK'){\n+     return {\n+        type:'technical_decision',\n+        angle:'engineering_tradeoff',\n+     } ;  \n+\n+\n+    }\n+    if(signals.async_change || signals.promise_change){\n+        return {\n+            type:'technical_decision',\n+            angle:'asynchronous_handling',\n+        };\n+    }\n+    if(signals.error_handling_change){\n+        return {\n+            type:'technical_decision',\n+            angle:'error_handling',\n+        };\n+    }\n+    if(signals.networking_change){\n+        return {\n+            type:'technical_decision',\n+            angle:'networking',\n+        };\n+    }\n+    if(totalWeight > 500){\n+        return {\n+            type:'technical_decision',\n+            angle:'large_change',\n+        };\n+    }\n+    return {\n+        type:'daily_update',\n+        angle:'small_win',\n+    };\n+}\n\\ No newline at end of file"
+    }
+  ]
+}

+      "changes": 47,
+      "blob_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/blob/90afd486f061c13512d07b75720ae7ce536d8b78/src%2Fai%2FProvider.js",
+      "raw_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/raw/90afd486f061c13512d07b75720ae7ce536d8b78/src%2Fai%2FProvider.js",
+      "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/garvthakre/Post90/contents/src%2Fai%2FProvider.js?ref=90afd486f061c13512d07b75720ae7ce536d8b78",
+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,47 @@\n+import fetch from \"node-fetch\";\n+\n+const HF_API_URL = \"https://router.huggingface.co/v1/chat/completions\";\n+\n+const MODELS = {\n+  MIXTRAL: \"mixtral-8x7b-32768\",\n+  LLAMA3_70: \"llama3-70b-8192\",\n+  LLAMA3_8: \"llama3-8b-8192\",\n+  GEMMA_7: \"gemma-7b-it\",\n+};\n+\n+const DEFAULT_MODEL = MODELS.LLAMA3_70;\n+\n+export async function callHuggingFace(prompt, model = DEFAULT_MODEL) {\n+  const res = await fetch(HF_API_URL, {\n+    method: \"POST\",\n+    headers: {\n+      Authorization: `Bearer ${process.env.HUGGINGFACE_API_KEY}`,\n+      \"Content-Type\": \"application/json\",\n+    },\n+    body: JSON.stringify({\n+      model,\n+      messages: [\n+        {\n+          role: \"system\",\n+          content: \"You are an expert software engineer who writes excellent commit messages.\"\n+        },\n+        {\n+          role: \"user\",\n+          content: prompt\n+        }\n+      ],\n+      temperature: 0.6,\n+      max_tokens: 300,\n+    }),\n+  });\n+\n+  if (!res.ok) {\n+    const errText = await res.text();\n+    throw new Error(\n+      `HuggingFace Groq Error: ${res.status} - ${errText}`\n+    );\n+  }\n+\n+  const data = await res.json();\n+  return data.choices?.[0]?.message?.content?.trim();\n+}"
+    }

+}

+      "filename": "src/analyze/commitAnalyzer.js",
+      "status": "added",
+      "additions": 50,
+      "deletions": 0,
+      "changes": 50,
+      "blob_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/blob/b70d99dd0f75a0c10d588ea45fccc048f3b10765/src%2Fanalyze%2FcommitAnalyzer.js",
+      "raw_url": "https://github.com/garvthakre/Post90/raw/b70d99dd0f75a0c10d588ea45fccc048f3b10765/src%2Fanalyze%2FcommitAnalyzer.js",
+      "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/garvthakre/Post90/contents/src%2Fanalyze%2FcommitAnalyzer.js?ref=b70d99dd0f75a0c10d588ea45fccc048f3b10765",
+      "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@\n+export function analyzeCommit(fileSummaries) {\n+  const signalCount = {};\n+  let totalWeight = 0;\n+\n+  for (const summary of fileSummaries) {\n+    totalWeight += summary.weight;\n+\n+    for (const signal of summary.signals) {\n+      signalCount[signal] = (signalCount[signal] || 0) + 1;\n+    }\n+  }\n+\n+  return {\n+    totalFilesChanged: fileSummaries.length,\n+    totalWeight,\n+    signals: signalCount,\n+    impact: classifyImpact(signalCount, totalWeight)\n+  };\n+}\n+\n+function classifyImpact(signals, weight) {\n+  if (\n+    signals.networking_change ||\n+    signals.env_variable_change\n+  ) {\n+    return 'HIGH_RISK';\n+  }\n+\n+  if (\n+    signals.async_change ||\n+    signals.error_handling_change ||\n+    signals.promise_change\n+  ) {\n+    return 'MEDIUM_RISK';\n+  }\n+\n+  if (\n+    signals.doc_image_change ||\n+    signals.doc_text_change ||\n+    signals.code_formatting_change ||\n+    signals.comment_change\n+  ) {\n+    return 'LOW_RISK';\n+  }\n+\n+  if (weight > 500) return 'HIGH_RISK';\n+  if (weight > 150) return 'MEDIUM_RISK';\n+\n+  return 'LOW_RISK';\n+}"
+    }
+  ]
+}

@@ -0,0 +1,26 @@
+export const TONES = {
+  pro: `
+Write in a professional, clear, industry-standard tone.
+Concise, factual, and suitable for senior engineers.
+`,
+  devlife: `
+Write like an experienced developer explaining changes to teammates.
+Friendly, casual, but still clear and technical.
+`,
+  fun: `
+Write in a light, playful developer tone.
+Still accurate, but slightly witty.
+`,
+  concise: `
+Write extremely concise.
+No fluff. No emojis. Just the essentials.
+`,
+    detailed: `
+Write in a detailed, explanatory tone.
+Provide context and reasoning behind changes.
+`,
+    optimistic: `
+Write in an optimistic, positive tone.
+Focus on progress and learning, even from challenges.
+`,
+};

@@ -6,8 +6,16 @@ Added documentation updates today üìò
 Sometimes small changes like better docs and visuals make a project 10x easier to understand.
 Keeping docs in sync with code is underrated but essential.
 
-What‚Äôs one thing you document every time?
-`
+What's one thing you document every time?
+`,
+    tech_stack_update: `
+Updated the tech stack mentions in the project üõ†Ô∏è
+
+Being transparent about what powers your project helps others learn and contribute.
+Every line of documentation matters.
+
+Building in public, one commit at a time.
+`,
   },
 
   learning: {
@@ -18,7 +26,7 @@ Promises and async/await look simple until edge cases show up.
 Refactoring with clearer async flows improved readability and error handling.
 
 Still learning‚Äîalways improving.
-`
+`,
   },
 
   technical_decision: {
@@ -29,8 +37,40 @@ Not all changes are about features‚Äîsome are about making future work safer and
 These decisions rarely show up in demos, but they matter most.
 
 Engineering is about trade-offs.
-`
+`,
+    error_handling: `
+Improved error handling today.
+
+Good error handling is invisible when it works, but saves hours when things break.
+Every try-catch block is a future debugging session prevented.
+
+Defense in depth.
+`,
+    networking: `
+Worked on network calls today.
+
+APIs are great until they're not. Proper error handling, retries, and timeouts matter.
+The difference between a flaky app and a reliable one is how you handle failures.
+
+Resilience by design.
+`,
+    large_change: `
+Big refactor today. 500+ lines changed.
+
+Large changes are risky but sometimes necessary for long-term maintainability.
+Careful testing and incremental commits make big changes manageable.
+
+Progress over perfection.
+`,
   },
-

+Celebrating the wins and learning from the challenges. 
+
+#DevLife
